content.title: Superior Mesenteric Artery Resection for Cancer
content.definition: En bloc resection of superior mesenteric artery with tumor involvement, typically for pancreatic cancer, with arterial reconstruction to maintain intestinal perfusion.

key_concepts.description: SMA abutment >180° or encasement traditionally considered unresectable. Select centers now offer resection with reconstruction.
Locally advanced but technically reconstructible. No distant metastases. Good performance status. Optimal neoadjuvant therapy response.
Requires surgical oncology, vascular surgery, interventional radiology collaboration.

imaging.cta: High-quality thin-slice CT with arterial and venous phase
imaging.assessment: Length of involvement, proximal and distal targets for reconstruction

preoperative_assessment.neoadjuvant: Most patients receive chemotherapy ± radiation before arterial resection

exposure.approach: Extended Kocher maneuver, root of mesentery exposure

resection.en_bloc: Tumor with SMA segment resected together
resection.margin: Ensure adequate arterial margins - frozen section if needed

interposition_graft.conduit: Autologous vein (GSV, femoral vein), or PTFE if vein unavailable
interposition_graft.technique: End-to-end anastomosis proximal and distal to resected segment

reimplantation.technique: SMA reimplanted to aorta or graft

alternative_inflow.selection: Based on anatomy and concurrent vascular disease

ischemia_time.tolerance: Intestines tolerate up to 60-90 minutes warm ischemia
ischemia_time.protection: Cold flush, minimize clamp time, expeditious reconstruction

combined_resections.sma_pv_smv: Often combined with portal vein/SMV resection
combined_resections.celiac: May require celiac resection (relies on GDA collateral via SMA)
combined_resections.sequence: Usually complete tumor resection, then vascular reconstruction

complications.intestinal_ischemia: Even with patent graft, reperfusion injury can occur

learning_objectives: Describe criteria for resectability of SMA-involved pancreatic cancer
Explain surgical technique for SMA resection and reconstruction
List conduit options and their advantages
clinical_pearls: Select patients carefully - arterial resection adds significant risk
Neoadjuvant therapy response helps predict benefit
Intestine tolerates ~60 minutes ischemia - work efficiently
